name: SSF19
title: CS Site-Specific Factor 19
subtitle: Tumor Base Transection Status
notes:
**Note 1**:  Record transection of the tumor base from documentation in pathology reports.  If the whole depth of tumor cannot be seen on a single specimen, the tumor base is considered to be transected.  Multiple specimens (two or more) may be taken from a  combinantion of biopsy and resection procedures.

**Note 2**:  Use code 010:

* If tumor depth is noted on multiple specimens (two or more).
* If only one specimen is taken and has positive deep margins.
* If the pathologist indicates the tumor base is transected.

**Note 3**:  If a single specimen removes the entire depth of tumor and deep margins are not involved, assign code 020.
rows:
Not applicable: Information not collected for this case
(If this information is required by your standard setter, use of code 988 may result in an edit error.)
No histologic examination of primary site

Unknown or no information
Not documented in patient record
